clinical_study.brief_title: The Association of SERPINA1 Gene Disturbance in Patients With Lung and Gum Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of SERPINA1 Gene Polymorphisms in COPD as a Risk Factor for Periodontitis

lead_sponsor.agency: Panineeya Mahavidyalaya Institute of Dental Sciences & Research Centre

clinical_study.source: Panineeya Mahavidyalaya Institute of Dental Sciences & Research Centre

brief_summary.textblock: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and periodontitis are chronic inflammatory diseases. The study aims to determine if the genetic polymorphism of SERPINA1 gene in patients with COPD serve as a risk factor for developing periodontitis.

detailed_description.textblock:
periodontitis is a polymicrobial inflammatory disease caused by various modifiable and non-modifiable risk factors. the non-modifiable risk factors include genetic polymorphisms like the gene coding for alpha-1-antitrypsinase
COPD is a chronic inflammatory disease characterized by deterioration of lung function due to loss of elasticity of the lungs.
SERPINA1 gene product has a protective role on the connective tissue components of both lungs and gums.
Hence, this study tries to determine if the gene polymorphism in COPD serves as a risk factor for developing periodontitis.

primary_outcome.description: of blood samples and running samples by PCR

arm_group.arm_group_label: SERPINA1 gene in COPD and periodontitis
arm_group.description: patients aged between 30-70 yrs with COPD (satisfying Gold's criteria) and chronic periodontitis (>4mm pocket probing depth)

intervention.description: 2ml blood sample collected from patients to extract DNA for assessment of SERPINA1 gene polymorphism
intervention.arm_group_label: SERPINA1 gene in COPD and periodontitis

biospec_descr.textblock: 2ml of blood sample from each subject will be collected in EDTA containing vials and kept at -20 degrees until DNA extraction. the genomic DNA will be isolated and Z/S polumorphism in SERPINA1 gene will be identified by PCR followed by restriction digestion pattern by Alu 1 restriction enzyme.

study_pop.textblock: patients,both male and female aged between 30-70yrs with COPD nd chronic periodontitis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients aged between 30-70yrs diagnosed with COPD and chronic periodontitis who are willing to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pateints with other systemic disorders
- patients not willing to participate in the study
